Articles.Content:
More than a few mod-makers are not supporting Win-64 KSP because of the bugs they get unfairly blamed for.

Last year StupidChris got fed-up with the many whiners around and withdrew RealChutes.

The MJ thread has recently been plauged by a PERSON who was convinced it WAS BROKEN and HAD to be fixed because HE couldn't play KSP without it.

Sarbian has now left Module Manager - which many other mods depend upon.

Time to give some New Year love!

Remember:

  • Mods are free
  • It takes a lot of work to make a useful mod and keep it up to date
  • Mod-makers still need to eat - so they're giving-up their time voluntarily
  • Apart from their wish to make things better for everyone there is no guarantee of quality, functionality or past/future compatibility
  • Mods, and the makers of mods, owe us exactly nothing
  • If you are new - ****ing off the maker of popular mod, that many people use, is not going to make you many friends ^^

Hug a mod-maker while you've still got a chance!
Hear, hear! KSP has the best, and some of the most knowledgeable, mod developers on this planet, and many others.
Friendly reminder that the little star shaped button in the bottom left of a user's post (next to Blog this Post) is the button to add to a user's reputation

Shame shame on the people who pressure modders! After my planet pack I was completely wiped out and desperately needed to spend a day off (even though I still had fun messing around with Kopernicus). But how do the real modders, the ones who make the models, textures, animations, etc. from scratch, do what they do? Respect for all the modders out there!
*big hug* soo big that the world blew up
